result.execSummary:
The defendant Samantha M. Mittlestadt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: This judgment is for fines, court costs and restitution that you were ordered to pay through Dept of Corrections - if not paid during probation - or you get revoked  and have not paid in full - you will be required to pay to the Clerk of Courts any unpaid amount plus interest.

supervisions.notes:
Court withholds sentence and places DE on probation for one year, must complete any counseling deemed appropriate by DOC.  Restitution $1500 to Walmart.  $253 court costs.  
Court addresses issue of amount of restititution.  DE had stated "thousands" had been stolen. DE requests expungement if successful on probation and restitution is paid in full.  Court holds expungement issue open, conditional on successfully completing probation and restitution obligations.  This would include any additional restitution requested by Walmart after DE atty and DA receive confirmation from Walmart that $1500 is adequate restitution for matter.
$100 bond to be forwarded to DOC.

miscConds.notes: $1500 plus surcharges   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

$253.00   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent

judgments.dispoDesc:
DE pleads No Contest, found guilty. Court withholds sentence and places DE on probation for one year, must complete any counseling deemed appropriate by DOC.  Restitution $1500 to Walmart.  $253 court costs.  
Court addresses issue of amount of restititution.  DE had stated "thousands" had been stolen. DE requests expungement if successful on probation and restitution is paid in full.  Court holds expungement issue open, conditional on successfully completing probation and restitution obligations.  This would include any additional restitution requested by Walmart after DE atty and DA receive confirmation from Walmart that $1500 is adequate restitution for matter.
$100 bond to be forwarded to DOC.
judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Probabtion revoked.  Court sentenced to 9  months in jail with huber  66 days credit.  Unpaid court obiligations converted to judgments.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Samantha M. Mittlestadt in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  State moves to amend Ct #1 to Misd. Retail theft, court so approves, DE pleads No Contest, found guilty. Court withholds sentence and places DE on probation for one year, must complete any counseling deemed appropriate by DOC.  Restitution $1500 to Walmart.  $253 court costs.  
Court addresses issue of amount of restititution.  DE had stated "thousands" had been stolen. DE requests expungement if successful on probation and restitution is paid in full.  Court holds expungement issue open, conditional on successfully completing probation and restitution obligations.  This would include any additional restitution requested by Walmart after DE atty and DA receive confirmation from Walmart that $1500 is adequate restitution for matter.
$100 bond to be forwarded to DOC.
of right to seek postconviction relief.

ADDRESS INFO for Samantha M. Mittlestadt
Current: 210 Grove Street Apt 102, Ridgeway, WI 53582 United States  (Effective: 06-11-2014)
Prior: 15870 Guard Street   - #107, Hayward, WI 54843

Defendant Samantha M. Mittlestadt in court with attorney Michael C Hoffman.  John M Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DEF acknowledges receipt of Information.  DEF enters Not Guilty plea. Parties have a resolution.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 29, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Samantha M. Mittlestadt in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives right to prelim.  Arraignment scheduled for May 13, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Samantha M. Mittlestadt in court with attorney Michael C Hoffman.  John M Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint, waives time limit for prelim,  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 11, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
DE appeared in court in person with Atty. Jim McLaughlin. Atty. Bruce Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Reset for initial appearance on 02-18-14 at 8:30 AM.

Atty. Bruce Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appeared in court in custody by video. No contact directly or indirectly with Wal-Mart. Absolute sobriety, may not possess any controlled substance without a valid prescription. Court finds probable cause. Cash bond of $100 and $900 signature bond. Reset to new court date of 01-14-14 at 8:30 AM.
